Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Court-martial \Court`-mar"tial\ (k?rt`m?r"shal), n.; pl. {Courts-martial} (k?rts`-). A court consisting of military or naval officers, for the trial of one belonging to the army or navy, or of offenses against military or naval law. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Court-martial \Court`-mar"tial\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Court-martialed} (-shald); p. pr. & vb. n. {Court-martialing}.] To subject to trial by a court-martial. [1913 Webster]
court-martial n 1: a military court to try serious breaches of martial law 2: a trial by court martial v : subject to trial by court-martial [also: {court-martialling}, {court-martialled}]
